author: BS Reporter
title: IRDAI to look into financial position for giving listing approval to non-life, health, reinsurers News
text:
Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) today said that for public issue of health, reinsurance and non-life insurers, they will consider the applicant company's overall financial position, its regulatory record and its capital structure post issue prior to giving approval.
In its guidelines on issue of capital by non-life insurers, reinsurers and standalone health insurers, IRDAI said that it may direct an Indian insurance company transacting the non- life insurance business or standalone health insurance business or reinsurance business to go for public issue if the circumstance so warrant.
The period for which the applicant company has been in the non-life insurance business or in standalone health insurance business or in reinsurance business, will also be taken into consideration. Its record of policyholder protection will also be looked into.
